description: Since 2016, UPI has been revolutionizing purchasing in India and has generated €2 trillion by 2023.
title: India's UPI mobile payment system: A soft power tool

description: At least five people were dead Sunday.
title: Violence in Haiti: Hundreds of inmates flee after armed gangs storm main prison

description: A few kilometers from the front, Ukrainian military engineers are racing against time to thwart the Russian advance into the Donetsk region, digging trenches and setting up rows of 'dragon's teeth' or 'Czech hedgehogs' to block the approaching enemy tanks.
title: Ukrainian soldiers in the Donbas rush to fortify their defensive lines ahead of the Russian army

description: In a double national referendum on retirement policy, 58.24% of Swiss voters backed a measure to add a 13th monthly payment to retirement pensions, while also voting at 74.72% against proposal to gradually raise the country's retirement age from 64 to 65.
title: Switzerland votes to boost to pension payments but not to raise the retirement age

description: A study by researchers from Stanford University has confirmed that there are behaviorally relevant differences in human brain organization between men and women – a result that calls for caution in its interpretation.
title: Can a human brain be male or female?

description: Though Jordan Bardella, the Rassemblement National party's president, has denied aiming for a 'hidden Frexit,' he has promoted a sort of buffet-style EU, with states being free to pick and choose whether to participate – or not – in all forms of EU 'cooperation.'
title: The French far right's nebulous plan to unravel the EU

description: In the third fatal Channel crossing incident this year, a small boat containing 16 migrants headed to the United Kingdom from northern France capsized, killing the young girl and leading to other passengers, including her family, being sent to hospital.
title: Channel migrant deaths: 7-year-old girl killed in crossing attempt

description: Having not received the warmest welcome at the Paris Agricultural Show, the French president found salvation at a Europe-tinged tasting session.
title: Macron and his charcuterie board. Does anyone care?

description: Sharif, for his second term as PM, will have to renegotiate an IMF bailout of Pakistan, wracked by economic, security, and democratic crises. His election was marred by accusations of rigging and the imprisonment of his main opponent, Imran Khan.
title: Pakistan elects Shehbaz Sharif as prime minister, amid protests and accusations of rigging

description: Authorized by a law for the Olympic Games, so-called 'augmented' video surveillance will be tested for the first time at two Depeche Mode concerts in Paris on Sunday, March 3, and Tuesday, March 5.
title: Paris Olympics 2024: Testing on algorithmic video surveillance of the Games begins

description: According to a regional public prosecutor, 3 villages in Burkina Faso were attacked a week prior, killing 170 and wounding others, among them women and young children. Another, separate, attack that week hit a mosque and church in the country's north.
title: '170 people executed' in Burkina Faso village attacks

description: The Ukrainian writer Oleksandr Mykhed was living near Kyiv when the war broke out just two years ago. He fled and joined the army as a volunteer. His parents, both academics, stayed on in Bucha, a city symbolic of the conflict. Everything has since changed: houses, bodies, feelings, friendships.
title: 'Lucky, Brioche and Me': A staggering tale of war

description: The former Head of Government of Mexico City, Sheinbaum emerges as the formidable frontrunner for the forthcoming June 2 election. She held her first major rally in the capital on Friday, March 1.
title: Mexico: Claudia Sheinbaum launches her presidential campaign, intertwining themes of environmental stewardship, feminism, and the perpetuation of AMLO's transformative legacy

description: On the bucolic shores of the Lac du Bourget, protests mount against Chambéry Airport, which is used every winter by an ever-increasing number of British tourists and private jets.
title: In the Alps, snow melts and air traffic soars

description: LeBron James became the first NBA player to reach 40,000 career regular-season points on Saturday, March 2, the 39-year-old superstar scoring nine against defending champion Denver to achieve the milestone.
title: Lakers' LeBron becomes first NBA player to score 40,000 career points

description: In October 2023, JFK's nephew left the Democratic Party to run as an independent presidential candidate. Anti-capitalist and anti-system, he is traveling the United States in search of support.
title: Robert F. Kennedy, the troublemaker seeking support among libertarians
